title.value: Revisiting the 2023 wildfire season in Canada
title.justification: The title is directly extracted from the given text of the paper.
title.quote: Revisiting the 2023 wildfire season in Canada

extractions.description: This paper examines the 2023 wildfire season in Canada, employing satellite data from Sentinel-2 and Landsat to map and analyze the extensive area burned and its impacts on land cover and biomass. The study highlights the enhancing role of the Tracking Intra- and Inter-year Change (TIIC) algorithm in providing detailed and timely wildfire mapping over large regions.

type.justification: The paper uses satellite data to empirically measure and analyze the burned areas and biomass loss during the 2023 wildfire season in Canada.
type.quote: We mapped and calculated the total area burned in Canada’s forested ecosystems in 2023, as well as the timing of these wildfires, the amount of aboveground biomass (AGB) affected, and the type of land cover impacted.

name.justification: The paper involves the use of satellite imagery for mapping wildfires, a fundamental aspect of Remote Sensing.
name.quote: Satellite data are ideally suited to provide near real-time wildfire information over large areas.

name.justification: The study focuses on monitoring the 2023 wildfire season using remote sensing technologies, making fire monitoring a clear sub-research field.
name.quote: Rapid detection of wildfires is essential to support the allocation of firefighting resources and ensure the safety of communities.

name.justification: The paper involves estimating the aboveground biomass affected by wildfires, making biomass estimation a relevant sub-research field.
name.quote: We also calculated the AGB impacted by the wildfires for each product.

name.value: Tracking Intra- and Inter-Year Change (TIIC) algorithm
name.justification: The TIIC algorithm is specifically mentioned and detailed as used for mapping burned areas.
name.quote: The Tracking Intra- and Inter-year Change (TIIC) algorithm was developed to monitor forest change across Canada’s forested ecosystems in near-real time by leveraging Sentinel-2A and -2B plus Landsat-8 and -9.

is_contributed.justification: TIIC is presented as a novel contribution of this research for near-real-time wildfire impact assessment.
is_contributed.quote: The novelty of the research presented herein in demonstrating an approach that enables accurate mapping of burned area in a manner that is both spatially detailed and timely.

is_executed.justification: The algorithm was executed as part of the study to analyze burned areas in Canada.
is_executed.quote: Fires in Canada’s forested ecozones were monitored in near-real time using the Tracking Intra- and Inter-year Change (TIIC) algorithm.

is_compared.justification: TIIC's results were compared to other mapping products like the NRCan fire perimeters.
is_compared.quote: We compared the results of the TIIC detection of burned area from the 2023 fire season with the results of the NRCan fire perimeters.
